be.jonaseveraert.util.progressBar

Interface ProgressBarHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProgressBarHandler

    public interface ProgressBarHandler
    An interface for the ProgressBarHandler class. This is used so that ProgressBarHandlers can be used in any other class while the ProgressBarHandler itself can be implemented to fit the needs of the platform the code is run on.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    %I%
    Author:
    Jonas Everaert, jonaseveraert.be
    See Also:
    ProgressBarHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int currentSubProcess 
      static int numActivitiesCompleted
      The number of activities completed for the current sub-process
      static int[] numActivitiesInSubprocess
      The amount of activities a subprocess has (e.g. if there are 100 activities in a subprocess, then each activity consists of 1% of the subprocess
      static int numSubProcesses
      The progressbar will be divided into numSubProcesses equal parts
      static double progress
      Indicates the percentage the progress bar was already completed
      static Object[] subProcessInfo
      The description of the sub process (e.g.
      static int SUBPROCESSINFO_BUSY 
      static int SUBPROCESSINFO_DONE

    • Field Detail

      • numSubProcesses

        static final int numSubProcesses
        The progressbar will be divided into numSubProcesses equal parts
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • numActivitiesInSubprocess

        static final int[] numActivitiesInSubprocess
        The amount of activities a subprocess has (e.g. if there are 100 activities in a subprocess, then each activity consists of 1% of the subprocess

      • subProcessInfo

        static final Object[] subProcessInfo
        The description of the sub process (e.g. Writing file) and the state (e.g. busy or done)

      • progress

        static final double progress
        Indicates the percentage the progress bar was already completed

    • Method Detail

      • setNumSubProcesses

        void setNumSubProcesses(int numSubProcesses)
        Sets the amount of sub-processes the process has. e.g. if there are 2 sub-processes, then each of them will take up 50% of the progressbar.
        Parameters:
        numSubProcesses - The number of sub-processes the process has.

      • setNumActivitiesInSubProcesses

        void setNumActivitiesInSubProcesses(int subProcessID,
                                    int numActivities)
        Sets the numActivities a sub-process with id subProcessID has. If there are 2 activities in a sub-process, then each activity will take up 50% of the sub-process' part of the progressbar
        Parameters:
        subProcessID - The id of the sub-process (in order from when you added the sub-processes, starting at 0)
        numActivities - number of activities the sub-process subProcessID has

      • setSubProcessInfo

        void setSubProcessInfo(int subProcessID,
                       String subProcessName,
                       int state)
        Sets the name and the state of the subprocess
        Parameters:
        subProcessID - the id of the subprocess
        subProcessName - the subprocess' name (e.g. Writing file)
        state - the subprocess' state (e.g. busy (= 0) or done (= 1). Used to append "..." or "." to the subprocess' name

      • setSubProcessInfo

        void setSubProcessInfo(int subProcessID,
                       String subProcessName)
        Sets the name and the state of the busy subprocess.
        Parameters:
        subProcessID - the id of the subprocess
        subProcessName - the subprocess' name (e.g. Writing file)

      • startProgressBar

        void startProgressBar()
        Initiates variables and components to start the progress bar and (tries to) show the progress window. Implementation note: This method is used to do things like set the cursor to busy, but most importantly, to calculate what part of the progressbar each sub-process and each activity takes up.

      • completeActivity

        void completeActivity(boolean autoCompleteSubProcess)
        Completes an activity of the current subprocess
        Parameters:
        autoCompleteSubProcess - If true, then completeSubProcess will automatically be called when all activities of a sub-process have completed.

      • completeActivities

        void completeActivities(int numActivitiesCompleted)
        Completes multiple activities, this method cannot autocomplete a sub-process, so the completeSubProcess has to be called manually (assuming it is not the last sub-process
        Parameters:
        numActivitiesCompleted - the number of activities the process has to complete

      • completeSubProcess

        void completeSubProcess()
        Completes the current subprocess without completing all (or any) activities

      • updateProgressBar

        void updateProgressBar(double addPercentage)
        Adds a percentage to the progress variable and updates the progressbar that was given in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        addPercentage - the percentage that needs to be added to the progress bar

      • setProgressBarpercentage

        void setProgressBarpercentage(double percentage)
        Sets the progress variable and the progressbar to a set percentage.
        Parameters:
        percentage - the percentage the progressbar will be set to

      • getProgress

        double getProgress()
        Returns:
        progress

      • completeProcess

        void completeProcess()
        This method is called when the process has finished. The implementation of this is different for every platform.

        i.e. for desktop, the cursor is set back to normal.

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(String message)
        Sets a message for the loading screen. Can be used to tell the user that the process has finished.
        Parameters:
        message - the message that will be desplayed in the text field
